definition: class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: If the city judge will not listen, he can prove it to the high court.
sentences.chinese: 如果本地法官不願意聽，他可以向高等法院證明。

sentences.english: The High Court shall comprise the Court of Appeal and the Court of First Instance.
sentences.chinese: 高等法院設上訴法庭和原訟法庭。

sentences.english: The Kentucky high court decided that in loco parentis justified that rule.
sentences.chinese: 肯塔基州高等法院決定讓“代替父母”辯護。

sentences.english: The high court agreed with the panel.
sentences.chinese: 高等法院同意這個專家組的看法。

sentences.english: High Court judge Hugh Bennett pronounced the decree on the basis that the couple had not lived together for two years.
sentences.chinese: 高等法院法官休班奈特的判決是基於兩人已分居二年。

sentences.english: Standing outside the high court, Sharp made a direct address to the US president.
sentences.chinese: 站在高等法院外，夏普直接向美國總統發出呼籲。

sentences.english: Criminal judgments can be appealed to one of the eight high courts.
sentences.chinese: 刑事判決可向八個高等法院中的一個上訴。

sentences.english: He's appealing to the High Court to reduce his sentence to a fine.
sentences.chinese: 他正向高等法院提出上訴，希望能將徒刑易科罰金。

sentences.english: As the High Court loathes perjurious oaths.
sentences.chinese: 正如高等法院摒棄僞證。

sentences.english: The charterers argued that there was indeed no dispute because they had admitted their liability as well as the amount of the claim.
sentences.chinese: 租船人於是起訴到高等法院要求撤銷仲裁裁決。

sentences.english: The three divisions of the High Court all have appellate functions.
sentences.chinese: 高等法院的三個分庭都有上訴審的職能。

sentences.english: Any further proceedings will take place in the Appellate Term of the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 任何進一步的程序都將於高等法院的上訴庭處理。

definition: Supreme Court of the United States
pinyin: Mei3 guo2 Zui4 gao1 Fa3 yuan4
